forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain after 4am. Partly cloudy. Low around 44, with temperatures rising to around 46 overnight. West northwest wind 3 to 7 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain before 4pm. Mostly sunny. High near 54, with temperatures falling to around 52 in the afternoon. South wind around 6 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the early hours of winter whisper through Downtown San Francisco, the city remains draped in a cool embrace, the air crisp and fresh. The forecast hints at a slight chance of rain as we venture deeper into the night, though the waning clouds seem reluctant to spill their contents. Temperatures hover gently around the mid-forties, with a light breeze tracing its way through the streets. It’s a good time for a soft scarf, perhaps, or a light jacket to keep the chill at bay while strolling through the quiet corners of the city.

As daylight approaches, the promise of a mostly sunny day unfurls cautiously, tempered by a similar slight chance of precipitation as the afternoon unfolds. Expect the high to linger near fifty-four, easing into a soothing coolness that may invite a light layer for comfort. The sun, when it breaks free, will paint the skyline, revealing the city's contours and shimmering waters. One might find solace in a leisurely walk along the Embarcadero, perhaps stopping for a warm drink to savor the blend of warmth and coolness that San Francisco mirrors so well today. A visit to a quiet café or a relaxed exploration of a local gallery would suit the day, allowing one to absorb the city's eclectic spirit.
